channel.title: BBC News - Wales

item.title: Levelling up: The seaside town fighting violence and frustration
item.description: Can the government's "levelling up" agenda help one of the most violent towns in England and Wales?

item.title: Shops and schools proposed for council election pilots in Wales
item.description: Could voting with your weekly shop boost turnout at next year's council elections?

item.title: Abergele: Man charged with murder of girl, 15, at holiday park
item.description: A 15-year-old girl died following a "domestic disturbance" at a holiday park on Saturday.

item.title: French Alps coach crash survivor graduates on mission to help others
item.description: Only the soles of Catrin Pugh's feet were not burnt when her coach crashed and burst into flames.

item.title: Strata Florida: Exhibition tracks rural life in Ceredigion
item.description: Mynachlog Fawr in 30 Objects aims to give a "vivid glimpse" into rural life through the ages.

item.title: Bridgend river death: Boy, 5, named as Logan Mwangi
item.description: Three people are arrested on suspicion of murder after Logan Mwangi, also known as Williamson, died.

item.title: Falling tree causes 'significant damage' to Powys house
item.description: No-one was hurt in the incident on Monday evening, Mid and West Wales Fire and Rescue Service says.

item.title: Hay director Peter Florence quits as gross misconduct claim upheld
item.description: Peter Florence was suspended in October following an internal complaint against him.

item.title: I'm a Celebrity...Get Me Out Here! to return to Wales in 2021
item.description: The 21st series of the hit ITV reality show is set to return to Gwrych Castle in November.

item.title: Coin marks 150 years since Alice in Wonderland sequel
item.description: The Alice in Wonderland themed £5 coin celebrates 150 years since Lewis Carroll's famous tales.

item.title: Covid-19: First people arriving into UK after rules relaxed for fully jabbed
item.description: People vaccinated in the EU or US do not need to isolate when coming to the UK from an amber country.

item.title: Cardiff Airport: New flight service to Edinburgh to start
item.description: They will be the first flights linking Cardiff and Edinburgh since Flybe collapsed last year.

item.title: French Alps coach crash survivor on mission to help others
item.description: Catrin Pugh overcame 96% burns to graduate with a first class honours degree in physiotherapy.

item.title: Alice in Wonderland sequel £5 coin 'evokes childhood memories'
item.description: The coin artist says all generations will enjoy the Through the Looking Glass themed scene.

item.title: Paralysed swimmer Paula Craig in English Channel record bid
item.description: Paula Craig was paralysed after being hit by a car in 2001 - now she aims to swim the Channel.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Hannah Mills and Eilidh McIntyre 'sick with nerves' in chase for sailing gold
item.description: Olympic champion Hannah Mills says she and partner Eilidh McIntyre have been "feeling sick with nerves every single day" as they go for gold in the women's 470 sailing.

item.title: Mobo: Welsh music of black origin project started to 'help give back'
item.description: The new project will allow five singers and producers to be mentored by music professionals.

item.title: Bradley John 'should be coming up to his 18th birthday'
item.description: Father of Bradley John, 14, says the fact he "took his life" at school is "very, very symbolic".

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Confident Jake Heyward into 1500m semis 'under the radar'
item.description: Welsh 1500m runner Jake Heyward wins his heat on his Olympic debut in Tokyo and says he is confident going into the semi-finals.

item.title: South Africa: Rassie Erasmus faces misconduct hearing for criticising officials in defeat by Lions
item.description: South Africa director of rugby Rassie Erasmus will face a misconduct hearing after his criticism of the match officials following their first-Test defeat by the British and Irish Lions.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: British sailors win gold, Karsten Warholm creates history, Simone Biles returns
item.description: Giles Scott earns Great Britain's second Olympic sailing gold on Tuesday, starting what Team GB hope will be a medal rush on day 11 of Tokyo 2020.

item.title: The Hundred: Bowlers lead Welsh Fire to win over Oval Invincibles
item.description: Welsh Fire strangle Oval Invincibles with a brilliant bowling performance at The Oval, to earn back-to-back victories in the women's Hundred.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Great Britain women and men progress in team pursuit
item.description: Great Britain progress in the women's and men's team pursuit as the track cycling gets under way at Tokyo 2020.

item.title: 'Y Rhyl yn un o'r trefi mwyaf treisgar a difreintiedig'
item.description: Ymdrechion yn Y Rhyl i adfer parch a disgyblaeth yn sgil ymchwil sy'n dweud ei bod yn dref dreisgar a difreintiedig.

item.title: Dynes â llosgiadau difrifol yn graddio i helpu eraill
item.description: Fe wnaeth Catrin Pugh ddioddef llosgiadau ar 96% o'i chorff mewn damwain bws yn yr Alpau yn 2013.

item.title: Adfywiad Cei Llechi Caernarfon yn 'dipyn o sioe'
item.description: Mae prosiect adfywio'r safle hanesyddol wedi ei gwblhau gan ddynodi pennod newydd i'r dref.

item.title: Oriel: Gig Eisteddfod Gudd
item.description: Blas o benwythnos o gerddoriaeth fyw wnaeth agor yr Eisteddfod AmGen.

item.title: Abertawe yn penodi Russell Martin yn brif hyfforddwr
item.description: Yr Elyrch wedi penodi cyn-reolwr MK Dons yn dilyn ymadawiad Steve Cooper.
